title: Alex Bregman shares his advice for younger Red Sox teammates down the stretch
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Alex Bregman advises younger Red Sox players to simplify their approach as the team fights for a playoff spot.
Boston Red Sox hold the AL's second wildcard position with a record of 81-68, entering the final 13 games of the season.
Red Sox have struggled recently, going 4-6 in their last 10 games, and face potential sweep by Yankees at Fenway.

title: 3 takeaways from the Revolution’s 1-1 draw vs. Toronto FC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Allan Oyirwoth made his first MLS start during the Revolution's 1-1 draw against Toronto FC at Gillette Stadium.
The Revolution's playoff hopes remain slim despite Chicago's loss, as New England remains 11th in the standings.
Young players like Allan Oyirwoth and Peyton Miller are showing promise for the Revolution's future under coach Caleb Porter.

title: ‘We should stop talking October’: Alex Cora doesn’t want Red Sox to start thinking about playoffs yet
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Alex Cora urges the Red Sox to avoid thinking about playoffs despite holding a wild-card spot.
The Red Sox currently have a 90% or higher chance of making the postseason from analytic models.
Roman Anthony's injury complicates Boston's lineup decisions against left-handed pitchers.

title: Red Sox CBO Craig Breslow reportedly prioritizing finding a GM this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Craig Breslow, Red Sox chief baseball officer, seeks a general manager as second-in-command for 2026.
The general manager role has been vacant since Breslow took over Red Sox baseball operations in 2024.
Assistant GMs Raquel Ferreira, Eddie Romero, and others are potential candidates for the open GM position.

title: Patriots move on from Ja’Lynn Polk, reportedly trading him to Saints
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots traded Ja'Lynn Polk to the Saints for a 2027 sixth-round pick, also sending a 2028 seventh-round pick.
Polk, a second-round pick in 2024, struggled in his rookie season with 12 receptions, 87 yards, and two touchdowns.
He suffered a preseason shoulder injury, ending his 2025 season on injured reserve, and was behind in the receiver lineup.

title: 5 things to know about Dolphins before Patriots take them on in Week 2
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots have a five-game losing streak against the Dolphins in Miami and face the threat of starting the season 0-2.
Dolphins head coach Mike McDaniel on the hot seat after a 33-8 blowout loss to the Colts in Week 1.
Dolphins' Tua Tagovailoa is undefeated in seven starts against the Patriots, despite modest individual game stats.

title: Review & setlist: Ethel Cain haunts Roadrunner with Southern Gothic epic
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Ethel Cain performed a captivating show at Roadrunner in Boston on September 12, 2025, with a Southern Gothic theme.
The setlist included tracks from her albums like 'Willoughby Tucker, I'll Always Love You' and 'Preacher's Daughter'.
Toronto band 9Million opened the concert, and Jae Matthews of Boy Harsher joined Cain for a surprise duet.

title: 45 years later, Andover High’s Chiklis returns to gridiron for ‘The Senior’
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Michael Chiklis stars in 'The Senior', portraying Mike Flynt, a 59-year-old returning to college football.
Chiklis reunited with Andover High teammates for a screening event in Boston on September 14, 2025.
Directed by Rod Lurie, 'The Senior' releases nationally on September 19, co-starring Rob Corddry and Mary Stuart Masterson.

title: Here are the Mass. residents who made the new Forbes list of 400 richest Americans
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Forbes' list includes nine Massachusetts residents, with net worths ranging from $3.9 billion to $35 billion.
Abigail Johnson, leading Fidelity Investments, is Massachusetts' wealthiest at $35 billion, ranking 27th nationally.
Robert Kraft, owner of the Patriots, ranks 78th with a $13.8 billion net worth, owing to his sports and gaming investments.

title: In most anticipated series at Fenway in years, Red Sox faceplant against Yankees in opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Yankees defeated the Red Sox 4-1 in a crucial series opener at Fenway Park.
The Red Sox collected only two hits and made three errors, facing challenges without key players Roman Anthony and Wilyer Abreu.
Boston's struggles with batting in scoring situations continued, going 0-for-8 with runners in scoring positions.
